env.name: TAG
env.label: Software version tag
env.description: Version of software. Leave blank to use default

env.name: INSTANCE_NAME
env.label: Container Name
env.description: Set the container name, hostname, and studio name for an Altus

env.name: IPV4_ADDRESS
env.label: IPv4 Address
env.description: IPv4 Address

templates.title: Coturn (host)
templates.description: Local STUN and TURN server to support WebRTC enabled products

env.name: TAG
env.label: Software version tag
env.description: Version of software. Leave blank to use default

env.name: INSTANCE_NAME
env.label: Container Name
env.description: Set the container name, hostname, and studio name for an Altus

env.name: DOMAINNAME
env.label: Domain Name for host system
env.description: This is the Domain Name you have assigned for the Proxy Server

env.name: HOSTIP
env.label: Host IP
env.description: The IP Address of the NIC on your host system that is routed to the internet.

env.name: PUBLICIP
env.label: Public IP
env.description: The Public IP Address the network this host is connected to.

env.name: TURNUSERNAME
env.label: Turn Username
env.description: Username that is used for authentication when TURN Connections are being made.

env.name: TURNPASSWORD
env.label: Turn Password
env.description: Password that is used for authentication when TURN Connections are being made.

env.name: MINIMUMPORT
env.label: Minimum Turn Port
env.description: Lowest number port used for turn connection. Leave this blank to use the default port number (49152) which works with most firewalls.

env.name: MAXIMUMPORT
env.label: Maximum Turn Port
env.description: Highest number port used for turn connection. Leave this blank to use the default port number (65535) which works with most firewalls.

env.name: TAG

env.description: Version of software. Leave blank to use default

env.name: INSTANCE_NAME

env.description: Set the container name, hostname, and studio name for an Altus

env.name: PTP4L_ARGS
env.label: ptp4l command line args
env.description: Command line arguments for ptp4l. Details here: linux.die.net/man/8/ptp4l. Leave blank if unsure

env.label: Software version tag
env.description: Version of software. Leave blank to use default

env.name: INSTANCE_NAME
env.label: Container Name
env.description: Set the container name, hostname, and studio name for an Altus

env.name: AOIP_IPV4_ADDRESS
env.label: AOIP IP Address
env.description: IP Address for the AoIP Network

env.name: EXT_IPV4_ADDRESS
env.label: External IP Address
env.description: IP Address for the External Network. The external network the non-AoIP network. The network that can connect to the internet, a license server, etc.

env.name: TAC_UID
env.label: User ID
env.description: Set the User ID for the non-root user. Leaving this blank will result in the root user being used.

env.name: TAC_GID
env.label: Group ID
env.description: Set the Group ID for the non-root user. Leaving this blank will result in the root user being used.

env.name: TAG
env.label: Software version tag
env.description: Version of software. Leave blank to use default

env.name: INSTANCE_NAME
env.label: Container Name
env.description: Set the container name, hostname, and studio name for an Altus

env.name: IFACE_AOIP
env.label: AoIP Network Interface
env.description: Name of Ethernet Interface for AoIP traffic. Use IFADDR_ANY for kernel routing

env.name: EX_CLOCK_SOURCE
env.label: Audio timebase source
env.description: Options: [ptp-snooping] Software PTP. Recommended in most cases | [clock-tai] OS TAI time | [/dev/ptp0] PTP hardware timestamp device

env.name: EX_AOIP_CLOCK
env.label: AoIP Clock Type
env.description: Applies to 'ptp-snooping' only, type of clock packets to receive: [0] PTP | [1] Livewire

env.name: EX_PTP_DOMAIN
env.label: PTP Domain Number
env.description: Applies to ptp-snooping with PTP packets only: Domain Number of PTP master

env.name: EX_AOIP_TASK_RATE
env.label: Task Execution
env.description: Set the rate at which AoIP packets are sent. This not packet length. It is how frequently packets are sent. The default is 1000 and ideal for most systems. More latency sensitive system should use lower numbers.

env.name: EX_RT_CPU
env.label: Realtime Reserved CPU
env.description: CPU number (using OS numbering) on which Forza will always run realtime tasks and never run non-realtime tasks. Leave blank to run all tasks on all CPUs

env.name: HTTP_PORT
env.label: Web Interface TCP Port
env.description: TCP Port used to run the web server that serves the GUI and API

env.name: TAG
env.label: Software version tag
env.description: Version of software. Leave blank to use default

env.name: INSTANCE_NAME
env.label: Container Name
env.description: Set the container name, hostname, and studio name for an Altus

env.name: IFACE_AOIP
env.label: AoIP Network Interface
env.description: Network interface on the host sytem AoIP traffic is routed to.Example eno1, or eth0. REQUIRED

env.name: IFACE_EXT
env.label: IFACE_EXT
env.description: Network interface on host system streaming and web browser traffic are routed to. Example eno1 or eth0. One interface is REQUIRED. It is recommended to list the IFACE_AOIP interface as well to allow GUI access from both networks. This is done with a comma delinated list. Exampl eno1,eno2

templates.title: Zephyr Connect (macvlan)
templates.description: Zephyr Connect Codec with `single macvlan` networking

env.label: Software version tag
env.description: Version of software. Leave blank to use default

env.name: INSTANCE_NAME
env.label: Container Name
env.description: Set the container name, hostname, and studio name for an Altus

env.name: IPV4_ADDRESS
env.label: IPv4 Address
env.description: Static IPv4 address to assign to the container. REQUIRED

env.name: IFACE
env.label: IFACE
env.description: Network interface the docker container connects to on macvlan. If ensure leave blank

templates.title: Zephyr Connect (dual-macvlan)
templates.description: Zephyr Connect Codec with `dual macvlan` networking

env.name: TAG
env.label: Software version tag
env.description: Version of software. Leave blank to use default

env.name: INSTANCE_NAME
env.label: Container Name
env.description: Set the container name, hostname, and studio name for an Altus

env.name: AOIP_IPV4_ADDRESS
env.label: IPv4 Address
env.description: Static IPv4 address to assign to the AoIP interface of the container. REQUIRED

env.name: EXT_IPV4_ADDRESS
env.label: IPv4 Address
env.description: Static IPv4 address to assign to the external interface of the container. REQUIRED

env.name: IFACE_AOIP
env.label: AoIP Network Interface
env.description: Network interface AoIP traffic is routed to. Example eno1, or eth0. REQUIRED

env.name: IFACE_EXT
env.label: IFACE_EXT
env.description: Network interface on host system streaming and web browser traffic are routed to. Example eno1 or eth0. One interface is REQUIRED. It is recommended to list the IFACE_AOIP interface as well to allow GUI access from both networks. This is done with a comma delinated list. Example eno1,eno2

templates.title: WebRTC Service (macvlan)
templates.description: Proxy service connected to the telosmacvlan network

env.name: STACK_NAME
env.label: Stack Name
env.description: Set the container names, and hostnames of each container in the stack.

env.name: NGINX_TAG
env.label: Software version tag for NGINX
env.description: Version of NGINX software. Leave blank to use default

env.name: NGINX_TELOSMACVLAN
env.label: NGINX AoIP IP address
env.description: Static IPv4 address assigned to the container. This address needs to fit in the telosmacvlan

env.name: TAP_TAG
env.label: Software version tag for Telos Auto Proxy
env.description: Version of Telos Auto Proxy software. Leave blank to use default

env.name: ACME_TAG
env.label: Software version tag for ACME
env.description: Version of ACME. Leave blank to use default

env.name: ACME_TELOSMACVLAN
env.label: ACME AoIP IP address
env.description: Static IPv4 address assigned to the container. This address needs to fit in the telosmacvlan

env.name: DOMAINNAME
env.label: Domain Name
env.description: Domain a certification will be requested for.

env.name: CERT_EMAIL
env.label: Email
env.description: Email certificate renewal notices will be sent to.

env.name: CERT_MODE
env.label: Certificate Mode
env.description: Sets whether ACME will pull a certification or just test. production - will pull a cert. staging - will test a cert. This template defaults to production.

env.name: COTURN_TAG
env.label: Coturn Software version tag
env.description: Version of software. Leave blank to use default

env.name: COTURN_TELOSMACVLAN
env.label: Coturn AoIP IP Address
env.description: Static IPv4 address assigned to the container. This address needs to fit in the telosmacvlan

env.name: PUBLICIP
env.label: Public IP
env.description: The Public IP Address the network this host is connected to.

env.name: TURNUSERNAME
env.label: Turn Username
env.description: Username that is used for authentication when TURN Connections are being made.

env.name: TURNPASSWORD
env.label: Turn Password
env.description: Password that is used for authentication when TURN Connections are being made.

env.name: MINIMUMPORT
env.label: Minimum Turn Port
env.description: Lowest number port used for turn connection. Leave this blank to use the default port number (49152) which works with most firewalls.

env.name: MAXIMUMPORT
env.label: Maximum Turn Port
env.description: Highest number port used for turn connection. Leave this blank to use the default port number (65535) which works with most firewalls.

env.name: BEACON_TAG
env.label: Beacon Software version tag
env.description: Version of software. Leave blank to use default

env.name: BEACON_TELOSMACVLAN
env.label: Beacon AoIP IP Address
env.description: Static IPv4 address assigned to the container. This address needs to fit in the telosmacvlan
